intro: Voyria corymbosa subsp. alba, commonly known as the white star vine, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, white, star-shaped flowers. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring partial shade and well-drained soil. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
